alert.note: Alert for Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 2:42PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Yavapai County along I-40 near Seligman through 315 PM MST... At 239 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms southwest of Seligman. Movement was northwest at 10 to 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of Yavapai County. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 94 and 118. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Hazardous slick roads and periods of reduced visibility are likely.
